creditline: Gift of Stephen Addiss and Audrey Yoshiko Seo
description: left scroll of a triptych; five large, curving dry-brush text characters; three smaller characters and two red seals along left edge; iridescent blue and pink brocade strips with white background above and below calligraphy; turquoise ceramic (?) roller ends
text: Chō Tōsai used a dry brush to create a distinctive writing style that is rather round and rolling, giving the otherwise linear seal script an interesting sense of fluidity. All together, from right to left, the triptych reads: “River winds seek my chanting; The mountain moon invites me to a feast; Heaven and earth become my quilt and pillow.”
title: River Winds [left scroll of a triptych]
